## pd.merge syntax


```{python}
pd.merge(left= people, right= test_info)

```


```{python}
# on argument
# this argument defines the key
pd.merge(people,test_info)

# on argument is optional as long as your key has the same name in both dataset.
```


```{python}
test_info_different_name
```


```{python}
pd.merge(people, test_info_different_name, left_on='name', right_on='first_name')
```

# Practice Q: left join TB

```{python}
tb_cases_children
```


```{python}
country_continents
```


```{python}
tb_cases_children_enriched = pd.merge(
    tb_cases_children, 
    country_continents, 
    left_on="country", 
    right_on="country.name.en", 
    how="left"
)
tb_cases_children_enriched
```
